title: How to Ace the PTE Writing Section: A Complete Guide
description: Struggling with PTE Writing? specific strategies for Essay Writing and Summarize Written Text to maximize your writing score.
author: PTE Team
content:
Understanding the Writing Section

The PTE Writing section tests your ability to produce written English in an academic context. It consists of two main task types: Summarize Written Text and Write Essay.

Summarize Written Text

You must summarize a passage of up to 300 words into a single sentence of 5-75 words. Tip: Use complex sentences with conjunctions like 'however', 'although', and 'because' to link ideas. Ensure you have only one full stop at the end.

Write Essay

You have 20 minutes to write a 200-300 word essay. Structure is crucial.

Essay Structure

  • Introduction: Paraphrase the prompt and state your opinion.
  • Body Paragraph 1: Argument 1 with supporting details/examples.
  • Body Paragraph 2: Argument 2 or counter-argument.
  • Conclusion: Summarize your main points and restate your verdict.

Key Scoring Criteria

Pay attention to:

  • Content: Did you address the topic?
  • Form: Is it within the word limit?
  • Grammar & Spelling: Avoid basic errors.
  • Vocabulary: Use academic vocabulary appropriately.
